website_summaries.verdict: Surprisingly low price for an HDD with better than average performance levels from trusted manufacturer.
pros: Available in capacities ranging from 500 GB to 6 TB
Built with a large cache memory area that enhances the performance level
Works especially well to store photos and videos with its nice transmission speeds
Ships with software that will help you make backup copies in a hurry
Low price for this size of hard drive
cons: Doesn't have longevity of some other WD drives

customer_reviews.title: Beware - Gray Market. No Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: Beware Gray Market! - Drive just failed. Called Western Digital. Under warranty? Nope. According to WD tech support, this drive (based on s/n) indicates it was part of a MyBook external unit. Since it was sold as a bare internal drive -- WARRANTY VOID. WD further says that to avoid this problem, any time you purchase a 'BLUE' labeled drive, first check the serial number against their website to see if it is a harvested MyBook drive or a true internal drive. My recommendation - avoid the confusion and don't buy 'BLUE' label WD drives.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Styles

customer_reviews.title: FAILED AFTER ONLY 18 MONTHS BIOHD-8 ERROR NOT RECOVERABLE
customer_reviews.text: WD20EZRZ Two terabyte hard drive completely failed after only 18 months of light use. Replacing with a Toshiba drive as this is the second Western Digital hard drive failure for me. Expect warranty replacement to be made but I will never put a WD drive in a critical application again. Quality / durability appears to be a problem, possibly based on location of manufacture. I can’t afford to spend my time restoring my system due to WD’s failure to provide a decent hard drive that will last a reasonable time.
customer_reviews.author: GWF545

customer_reviews.title: Read this about Western Digital drives.
customer_reviews.text: Western Digital has a problem with their drives overall it seems. Had problems from the git go with drive being hard to access after computer went to sleep. Wouldn’t wake up and affected entire computer performance requiring a hard reboot. Looked on the internet and found a lot of information regarding the issue, but no viable fix that worked and I tried several. Seems most of their drives have issues. Finally had enough and got a Seagate drive and problem is gone and computer performance improved 1000%. Wished I had sent it back early on. I spent 6 months working with drive and so glad I replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: This is for the 6TB version sold by a 3rd party vendor
customer_reviews.text: I checked the serial number (on the advice of other reviewers) on Western Digital website the day I received the hdd and it was not under warranty because of it's OEM status. Not only was it not warrantied, but the drive came in a larger box (bouncing around during transit) with only a static bag for protection. Buyer beware the 6TB sold by 3rd party vendors. I promptly applied for a refund and bought it elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Hard drive arrived in plastic electrostatic bag, so not new in box. The unit was dead on arrival. Produced a series of 5 squeaky clicks several times while system was booting up. Using Windows 10 Disk Management, it was giving I/O errors and unable to initialize & format. Returned unit and went with WD Black 6TB instead. I currently have 2 WD 1TB Blacks, 1 WD 3TB Blue, and 1 WD 4TB Green. The oldest drives are probably 10 years old. Never had this problem before. WD has always been reliable. Since this unit wasn't new in box, its hard to say where it came from (OEM, salvaged from external drive, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Wuznme

customer_reviews.title: The Leader In Reliability
customer_reviews.text: I own a small computer shop and use these drives all the time. I'm phasing out Seagate, even though they are faster for cheaper. When I see a failed drive that is less than 2 years old, it's almost never a Western Digital. I've seen failed HGST, Toshiba, and mostly Seagate. There is a reason these have 5 stars. They are rock solid reliable.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Arrived DOA
customer_reviews.text: I am a Western Digital bigot and have had excellent experiences with their products, some still operating after 8 years. This item is totally dead, will not spin up (tried it on multiple computers) and no luck. Very familiar with hard drive installations, setup, etc., but this is the very first drive I've ever received that was completely dead. Yes, I'm still a WD fan and will consider this a fluke as compared to over 45 drives that worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dale in Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: Another reliable WD Blue
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, great value, and reliable from experience. Purchased this 2TB WD Blue to replace 5-year-old 500GB WD Blue that worked well but was too small for my current needs. The 64MB cache on this new one gives an improved response over the 16MB cache that was on the old one. Used a free version of EaseUS Data Recovery Wizard to clone this as the new OS drive (the c: drive). The Acronis cloning software on the WD site just isn't as good; it wouldn't allow me to add the unallocated space on the new drive to the system partition. The EaseUS software allowed me to make the partitions I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Failed 3 months after 2 year warranty period ended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive based upon Amazon reviews and the two year warranty. Generally speaking if I drive lasts a year it should last five. WD? Nope. I am utterly flabbergasted that this one lasted 3 months after the warranty ended.. I have similar sized drives in other systems that are on their fourth or fifth year, running 7 x 24 x 365. All systems are connected to very sophisticated surge protectors.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Grove

customer_reviews.title: Died after only 6 months and only a handfull of uses.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this drive for our backup comp and after 6 months and only maybe 8-10 uses it is now completely dead. Thank goodness that we didn't have too important stuff on this one. Stay away from this one, its not worth the risk. Its cheap, but there is a reason for that, you get what you pay for......
customer_reviews.author: TheBakingSlave

customer_reviews.title: Failed right after the warranty was up!
customer_reviews.text: So, this drive failed on the S.M.A.R.T. tests just after the warranty period was up. This drive was in my system as a redundant backup drive and wasn't accessed very often. Perhaps once a week at most. The rest of the time, the drive slept. So, failure only after 100 to 150 writes? TERRIBLE! So, my data, gone... And I'm a little freaked because I got two of these drives and the other one is my C Drive. Looks like I should maybe look into a system refresh with another drive manufacturer. It's a shame. Western Digital drives used to be amazing and long lasting. Now, they're made to be paperweights within 24 months. Horrible. Will never buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Angel Q.

customer_reviews.title: First One Was DOA
customer_reviews.text: A previous 1TB WD drive died after two years. Sent it in for warranty replacement, but replacement was denied due to "tampering" -- which never happened. While I would have preferred to purchase another brand, WD still has the best overall reliability, so I went with a 2TB replacement. First drive arrived promptly, but was DOA. Neither Windows, MiniTools, nor WD's own Data Lifeguard software could recognize it. Returned immediately to Amazon and a replacement arrived the following day. Installed and working fine -- so far. I will update if problems occur. No drive is 100% perfect forever. But WD's reneging on the 1TB drive's warranty is troubling. A warranty is worthless if it is not honored.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found this
customer_reviews.text: Kudos to two parties: Amazon and Western Digital!!! Amazon for actually stocking this item. I couldn't find it at any of my local computer supply stores. And Western Digital for providing a unit at this size and such a great price!!! Has been working like a charm so far. Been filling up this drive with iTunes music files and movies!!! So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny Zaragoza

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, performs well, kind of noisy.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2 TB WD Blue HDD (SATA, 64MB cache). This is a 5400 RPM drive, but hard to tell the performance difference versus 7200 RPM drive it replaced as the cache does a good job of maintaining the R/W speed. This unit replaces one from another major vendor; the original unit was starting to become unreliable after almost 7 years of use in a SOHO environment. I different I noted is that the WD unit, you can hear the heads moving tick, tick, tick in a quiet room. So, you may not want to use this one in use cases such as a media center or other low noise environments.
customer_reviews.author: Hardware Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Generally good disks.
customer_reviews.text: These are good disks for most people. I abused mine a bit though in a RAID setup which these are NOT designed for but can handle for a while. The RED version is better equipped to handle NAS and RAID use. Since these just store media files, putting them into a RAID enclosure outside of their design intention doesn't seem to be an issue. So far in the 15 years I've been using WD Blue disks, we have only had one single failure which we were at fault for. I dropped a disk. My bad.
customer_reviews.author: BradFoxUS

customer_reviews.title: Every product will have have a few DUDS once in a while, I was the "lucky" one this time.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 2TB drive to gain additional space..BUT, the system will not complete the boot process with this drive connected using the cables that functioned with the original drive. The system displays the motherboard logo then freezes as the BIOS checks for items connected to prepare Windows to load. Bum drive. Good News: Amazon handled the problem nicely for me as the original supplier to them doesn't accept returns. For what it's worth, I use a number of hard drives each year as I build computers; and this is my first Western Digital failure in over two years...
customer_reviews.author: Alpha1

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Amazing hard drive I love western digitals stuff so much Pros 1. Faster boot time from previous hard drive 2. No sound at all silence 3. Especially easy to install Cons 1. Heavy!!!!!!!!! 2. Bad shipping method two plastic holders and a anti static bag that’s it Amazing hard drive though
customer_reviews.author: TheMortalVirus

customer_reviews.title: BAD Drive Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this drive for Amazon PrimeDay in 2019, the first drive failed immediately and they replaced it. However I was leery about installing it into my PC so i shelved it for later use. I installed the drive in a PC last night and installed windows on it, however after installing windows and updates the drive failed. Apparently this drive only has a 1 year manufactures warranty and i am out of the warranty window. I have always been a Blue Man for WD Drives, but am starting wonder about their policies.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Fichtenmayer

customer_reviews.title: Came dead. Thought it has been working but I ...
customer_reviews.text: Came dead. Thought it has been working but I guess my external that is the same size runs off a SATA so I thought it was running and setup right. Thought they were copying each other until my external failed and I realized this guy was never running. Fail on my part, but fail on this drive's part too. Seems to spin up which was partly why I thought it was alive and RAIDing, but multiple SATA connectors not working so probably a SATA fail on HDD side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hard drive at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I love western digital and I love this hard drive. I put this in a computer to install my steam games, epic games, blizzard games, etc on it and it has been working just fine. I plan to buy a lot more of these (I have a lot of computers). This hard drive feels like the sweet spot for performance, quality, storage capacity, and price right now.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D. Espenschied

customer_reviews.title: Drive failing after 18 months - replacement broke within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I started getting bad sectors less than 12 months in one of the 2 drives I bought for my Synology NAS. Last week DSM reported that drive was too corrupted to be used in my RAID. Update: After receiving a replacement, re-certified (not new) unit as part of warranty claim, the physical SATA connector failed in less than 2 months rendering the drive useless. $170 down the drain in less than 2 years. I strongly advise buyers avoid purchasing drives from Hard Drives for Sale merchant.
customer_reviews.author: elementsuser

customer_reviews.title: Came packaged well, pretty fast
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a NAS (before I found out that I should have bought a Red drive, oh well). Not much to really say other than it came working and that it was packaged very well. Write speeds are quite good from what I can see, I was backup up data from a dying laptop to the NAS (WD MyCloud Ultra EX2) over Ethernet, and it was writing ~40MB/s on average.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Durden

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year, it has failed
customer_reviews.text: Bought Apr 15th 2019. It failed ~Nov 30th 2019, formatted ext4 on Linux was used for storing data. Backups written to it only & not frequently...Single file @ a time. The drive spins, it seems the board has failed, as there is no click of death the data may be retreivable @ a cost of course. & I trusted WD so much :-)
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Rockstar

customer_reviews.title: Been working for about 2 years without and sector errors and has many hours on it.
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest HDD but it's been working as a primary drive for gaming. I use the second one as a backup. Haven't had any bad sector errors or problems at all. I plan on upgrading to two 4TB drives soon due to the increasing size of games, but these will work nicely on my old Windows 7 gaming rig. (32-Bit operating system for games like Max Payne 3) The HDD also runs pretty coolly.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance and storage size for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just got this drive, but so far so good! Drive comes unformatted, which is fine. I formatted and was immediately moving data over to it. I've generally always been a fan of Western Digital drives for their quality, price, and performance. Installation was easy, the product arrived quickly and in good packaging. I will update my review if I have any issues, but it has been a very long time since I've had a drive misbehave or die on me.
customer_reviews.author: Ramze

customer_reviews.title: I had to disable the intelligent feature on it
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in my tivo series 3. I had to disable the intelligent feature on it. So this was not the right drive for me to get for the tivo, as I had to download extra software and run code to disable. No fault of the drive. I would assume no one reading this review is using this for a Tivo? For the price this is a great 5400 rmp drive so far and we shall see how long it lasts in my tivo running 24/7.
customer_reviews.author: critic

customer_reviews.title: Never had an issue just this one had bad capacity..happens its ok
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect but storrage capacity was not satisfactory.. i know it will never be at the written amount but this time it was so much less
customer_reviews.author: Slavik

customer_reviews.title: Works as external drive with directv HD24
customer_reviews.text: Purchase to use with directv HD24 that failed to recover. It had been doing check disks for a month. Using with Startech cradle for data connection. Plugged it in to hd24, powered the cradle, then powered hd24. HD24 formatted drive in about five minutes and then when through normal satellite detect. I had to set all shows to record again. I set the fan on cradle to about half speed. I have both in a medium size cabinet using RF remote. Been using for about 3 weeks. No issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W. Howerton

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine So Far
customer_reviews.text: Installed quickly and no problems so far. Seems to perform to specifications. Setup had no hiccups. I'm a little bit disappointed that it didn't come with mounting screws. You'll have to search for mounting screws that are only 1/8th" or less, because some of the mounting holes will only accept shorter screw lengths. Will update if I run into any issues or have the inspiration to add anything in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Koda

customer_reviews.title: Worked with my old PC when the Seagate drive wouldn’t
customer_reviews.text: Could not get the BIOS (yes, old PC) to work with the Seagate 2TB BarraCuda SATA 6Gb/s 64MB Cache 3.5-Inch Internal Hard Drive (ST2000DM006). It threw SMART errors, only 4GB size under BIOS setup, 128GB under Windows. GParted would not work with it either. But the WD Blue 2TB Desktop Hard Disk Drive - SATA 6 Gb/s 64MB Cache 3.5 Inch - WD20EZRZ worked great. Zero trouble. Installed, formatted and in service in under 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Comes from 3rd party seller decent unit
customer_reviews.text: I like having all my files in one 6tb unit in one place however it was strange to get a warranty from the 3rd party seller when it should come with a warranty straight from Western Digital.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Barr

customer_reviews.title: How long is this product suppose to last?
customer_reviews.text: I received this product on August 10th, 2018. It worked fine these past five months up until two days ago. It was for my security DVR system, but it suddenly stopped working. The hard drive was broken and I didn’t expect it too last that shortly. My previous hard drive worked a good few years.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ni

customer_reviews.title: Good Drive.  Poor shipping.
customer_reviews.text: The drive arrived on the same day as advertised. However, it was shipped in it's static pouch. It was at the bottom of the amazon box with a bubble pouch on top. Zero insulation on the bottom and sides. I was a bit concerned but the drive works. Hate doing returns.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Reliable...? Not so much
customer_reviews.text: It's been over a year and still going strong. This was a replacement for a failed 1TB drive that lasted me well over 5 years. I hope to get that much service from this drive. _ UPDATE: almost 2years to the month. The drive failed. Seeing as my options are limited it looks like I will be purchasing another :( And another thing... What is the SMART protocol worth if it never tells you the drive is failing! #WORTHLESSTECH
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Stops spinning
customer_reviews.text: When used as a 2nd drive, this WD Blue drive winds down like the WD green model. When you open a file on the drive it spins up with out issue, just takes a little time. I wasn't expecting this delay from a Blue drive. No other issues at present.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: slowwww
customer_reviews.text: its a 2tb drive, I don't know why I should rate its "capacity" I'm literally paying by the byte, it hardly hits 90mb/s sequential, but its quiet and hopefully reliable so thats all there is to it, could be like 20$ cheaper though
customer_reviews.author: Enmanuel

customer_reviews.title: WARNING-NO MANUFACTURERS WARRANTY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item less than a year ago and it crashed after 8 months. The ad says that it has a 2-year manufacturer's warranty, Western Digital says THERE IS NO MANUFACTURER'S ON THIS ITEM. There is no way to send it back to Amazon or get support from them. DON'T Buy this item unless you want NO WARRANTY.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive to replace the exact same one I had which died after a year-and-a-half of use. This seemed unusual as I've owned many Western Digital hard drives before and never had one die on me. So I wrote that off as a fluke and got another. This one lasted FIVE MONTHS and died last week.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Shvartsman

customer_reviews.title: Not Getting Full Waranty
customer_reviews.text: I am only getting 16 month warranty on these drives when I register with WesternDigital. I have purchased before and gotten the full 24 months, but something funny is going on. Be aware you may not get full warranty Edit 10/27/16 - purchased another one and when registered on Western Digital site only got an 18 month warranty.
customer_reviews.author: TEC

customer_reviews.title: SKETCHY
customer_reviews.text: Not in standard WD packaging and doesn't seem legit. Returning it and buying a real WD drive. Not happy that they wasted my time.
customer_reviews.author: Viewfinder

customer_reviews.title: It's a Western Digital
customer_reviews.text: Good unit. Have always had good luck with Western Digital, see no reason to expect that would change at this point. Only time will tell about the reliability, but the drive functions as designed out of the (proverbial) box.
customer_reviews.author: WxMan

customer_reviews.title: 1Tb and 2 Tb HDD's are reasonably priced and give you the most bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Product it has become the standard HDD for any of my new PC builds or upgrades. For the Majority of users, 1 TB is more memory than they will ever need. Additionally its a perfect option for those who just need to upgrade or add additional memory to their existing PC's. With prices for SSD's still being on the steep side, I would Definitely recommend this product to anyone in the market for HDD's.
customer_reviews.author: The StreetGeek

customer_reviews.title: Good HDD
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy starting off, it doesn’t make any noise and it is a very quite piece of hardware. One thing I would suggest is investing in Solid State Drives and M.2 Drives due to their increased speeds. Another recommendation would be to invest in larger storage such as 2 or 4 Terabytes for those of you who have a large game library or a large onset of programs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good drive
customer_reviews.text: If only I knew seagate sold a 2 TB drive at the same price but it has an rpm of 7200 instead of this ones 5400. But that’s my mistake, this is still a great drive, does what it says, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive!
customer_reviews.text: WD Blue are good drives for the money. I had a 1TB Seagate Black Armor NAS in my recycling bin that had died a horrible death. I bought one of these WD Blue drives for another system, and on a whim, I plugged it right out of the box into the BA NAS in place of the original drive. When I powered it on, to my amazement, the NAS formatted the new drive automatically and it came right up, good as new at twice the capacity. It's on my network now - I named it Lazarus!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a Western Digital
customer_reviews.text: Speed was not important but reliability was. That is why i went for a slower spinning drive. Western Digital makes good drives, what can i say.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Reliability
customer_reviews.text: I would expect nothing less from WD. This is whisper quite. I use this as an external hard drive housed in an external hard drive case and connected to my system via USB 2.0. It's fast, quite and reliable and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Freya Turner

customer_reviews.title: Solid Drive at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Nothing earth-shattering to report, which is a good thing! This drive was recognized immediately by my system and it serves its intended purpose well - data backup.This drive is not 7200 RPMs and as such is not ideally suited for video editing; backups and general tasking / storage is what this drive handles best. If your budget permits, pick up a couple to have on hand for redundant data backup! This is a solid drive for the money - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Blue

customer_reviews.title: Great extra storage drives.
customer_reviews.text: I've installed dozens of this model as secondary (backup or storage) drives. They are quiet and plenty quick for the intended purpose. No issues with any of them. I have 3 in my main PC for additional file storage that have been up for 2 years. Hard to beat for the $$$
customer_reviews.author: EmJi5859

customer_reviews.title: Both lasted about a year before failure.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these about 2 years ago and it failed after about 13 months. I bought a second one to replace it hoping for better luck but after about 14 months the second one has failed.
customer_reviews.author: JL31

customer_reviews.title: great price had problems with my cable but not the drive.
customer_reviews.text: im having a problem with my drive. its making a noise every few minutes and its so bad I can feel the vibration through my whole computer desk. it works but im scared it might stop at any moment. ok I changed my sata cable and after that the noise stopped so I guess then I have nothing bad to say so ill put my stars back to 5
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: My last order of three of these drives had one defective drive,and there isn't a return policy from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a few of these same drives over the past two years and I've had very good luck with them. Up to this point anyway. But, on this last order where I purchased three of these drives, one of them was defective and it will not initialize at all. And, there isn't a return policy from Amazon at all, so I will have to go through WD if I want to get it fixed or replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hosea

customer_reviews.title: Drive failed and didn't receive new drive after filing for warranty
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, my drive failed after a couple months, and as the WD Blue drive has a 2 year warranty I decided to call WD. The return went mostly smoothly, my drive cost me $14 to ship and WD didn't cover any of that. After three weeks I received a WD Green drive which is significantly lower quality. I was scammed by Western Digital. Get a better drive, there are better companies out there, better yet get a Samsung solid state drive.
customer_reviews.author: Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work fine. Windows sees 6 TB
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine. Windows sees 6 TB. One tip if you are installing the OS (Windows 7, 8 or 10) and want a single 6 TB partition is to hit Shift F10 when you boot the Windows media and convert this disk to GPT partitioning from MBR. You use diskpart to do it. If memory servers, it was something like "select disk 0" and then "convert gpt". Now, don't quote me on the disk 0 in your configuration if you have other hard disks. And, you must have an EFI BIOS that can boot GPT partitions (most modern motherboards are this way).
customer_reviews.author: G Dog

customer_reviews.title: Stick with baracuda drives
customer_reviews.text: DOA, showed up in BIOS as a 0gb drive, impossible to format or use from any os, WD refused, fortunatly the seller took it back. So I bought a baracuda drive instead, same size, cheeper, and not FUBAR.
customer_reviews.author: Jamcdonald120

customer_reviews.title: A sales rep at Micro Center recommended this drive when I needed the best to go ...
customer_reviews.text: A sales rep at Micro Center recommended this drive when I needed the best to go with my dual bay enclosure. Took it home and was real impressed with the speed over a networked router so I checked the amazon price and bought another one. The only thing with Amazon is that you don't get the retail box but it's no big deal. I can definitely see the speed difference between this drive in a docking station compared to a fully built USB direct WD external, worth the money

customer_reviews.title: It works well.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a backup external drive and it is fast. It seems to be more consistent in the speed of my copies. As far as gaming goes I'm not a gamer so I don't know that's why I gave it a three. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Added some more storage in my tower computer. It was easy to install and has been running for months now. It is fast and has added some needed storage for my photos.
customer_reviews.author: stoddone

customer_reviews.title: This item Did Not work,
customer_reviews.text: Strong possibility this item is Not directly from the Brand. study your Serial Code, Cause the description didn't line up with the item i purchased.
customer_reviews.author: jerome haynes

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old Western Digital Green drive that recently failed. I use this drive to store music, movies, and tv shows. It's been running non stop since I got it about 20 days ago and so far everything has been smooth. WD has got a name for being a great and reliable brand and other than their green drives I would say that is true. This drive has been excellent for what I need it for and I have no doubts it will last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ash Ketchum

customer_reviews.title: I use this in an external enclosure
customer_reviews.text: Great price per GB. I use this in an external storage enclosure and it's been great. I've used WD Blue drives for many years and never had an issue with them. Solid, reliable storage for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: I worked in our PS4. It replaced a 500gb that came with the PS4. However it only lasted a year. The disk was making a whine and a hammering click sound. The read write head was doing a little jig in there unable to settle down and read. I put this down to air pollution and dust that accumulates in and around electronic devices which make them run hot. I really only know it was dusty and hot when I blew out the PS4 for another replacement disk.

customer_reviews.title: Works but noise
customer_reviews.text: Just now having to use it bought it as a spare it works good but noise as all get out it makes all kind of grinding noise fixing to replace it can't stand the noise it makes constantly
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: I don't not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these in the last year both have stopped working very quick. Worst part is I only used it one a month. Read that they are actually being recycled from old Mybooks. I would not recommend this
customer_reviews.author: logan walton

customer_reviews.title: Other say they didn't get what they ordered, but I did!
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Western Digital hard drives through Amazon since I got fed up with the out-of-the-box problems that Seagate drives now have. This drive is just as good as the others I've ordered and the price is great. Many have complained about receiving drives that are already old and out of warranty...but I registered this drive and it has been verified by WD as having the full 2 year manufacturer warranty...PLUS all of the blocks check out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Jakobs

customer_reviews.title: This drive is not a plug and play.  It must be formatted.
customer_reviews.text: The install for this was not easy for someone who does not know how to format a drive. Easy enough to access information on utube, but if your new, or a beginner, it could prove a little frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: back then
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good hard drive just that now there are seagate for 4TB with better features and pricing. But it is a good hard drive. I bought around 2 years ago and it still rocking today.
customer_reviews.author: Yunio

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but does not come with any cables. I had to order the power cable separately. I got that ordered so now it is installed and working perfectly. I am using it to store my DVD library as I rip them and import them into my iTunes library. So far every thing is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Snow

customer_reviews.title: Good Inexpensive HD
customer_reviews.text: So I was running out of room on a back-up drive, and I needed to get a 2TB to replace it. These Blues fit the bill. They're inexpensive, pretty robust and suited for applications that don't require a lot of constant access to data.
customer_reviews.author: Piixel Pusher

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for about a month now (storage drive). No issues. Should any come up I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Ian L. Mcdougal

customer_reviews.title: But wouldn't recommend it for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Little shake of the computer may shut it off due this hdd. When this hard drive is disconnected or disabled the issue doesn't exists. I'm using it this hard drive to store my archives and not accessing it often, so I mostly have it disabled. But wouldn't recommend it for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hard drive!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this 5400 RPM on my Windows 10 computer as a "D drive" and I love it! It is quiet and runs cool without a fan. I'll be getting another one later as a back up and getting the 7200 RPM later as a back up for my "C drive". Fast and easy to format with W10. Very good hard drive, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: RickTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to a RAID 1 with these
customer_reviews.text: One thing to say is be careful with the Sata plug. I broke the plastic on the drive and had to buy a new drive.
customer_reviews.author: Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Yep this is good
customer_reviews.text: It was what my grandson wanted since he is learning to build computers. He said it fir great and was the right storage capacity for him to get started. He is very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Davis, P.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Installed the drive about 3 weeks ago, the following week, the drive crashed and totally died. Ran it to an expert to make sure it wasn't something else and by the time I got it back, the return window had closed. In all fairness, I have always used Western Digital in the past and never had an issue so this is new for me and has me particularly upset.
customer_reviews.author: TaxProJoe

customer_reviews.title: Good Generic Storage
customer_reviews.text: This was the best deal for vanilla file storage on a new PC that I wanted to augment. Have been using the PC and drive now for 5 months with no issues. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: FreqAmznShoppr

customer_reviews.title: Bigger = Less
customer_reviews.text: first one came DOA but was replaced for free, when i received the second HD I realize that it will not be exactly 6TB, I cant remember the reasoning behind that whole thing but I wasn't expecting to missout on .55TB. That's right mine only came with 5.45TB, that's a lot of potential storage for video i'm missing out on.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE NOT RETAIL PRODUCT!!! DECEPTIVE LISTING!!
customer_reviews.text: Received my hard drive. Nothing wrong with it per se, what is disappointing is that Amazon neglected to mention in their product description that this is not a retail product. It is white box oem. The warranty is not the same is advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Nom de Plume

customer_reviews.title: So far so good and it's been a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: So far so good and it's been a couple of months. My D/E: drive which is a separate unit from the C: drive was giving me warnings of imminent failure so I got it backed-up then copied all data to this replacement. I've had drive failures in the past from WD (including DOAs), but always very good support getting back on track.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D

customer_reviews.title: Great back up HDD.
customer_reviews.text: Great hard drive for back up, I am running a gaming pc and have a 500 gb SSD that I have windows 10 installed on. I put most of my games/photos and other files on this hard drive and it works just fine. There are other options out there that do the same thing, but are a little faster and perform better, but I'm not having any issues using it at all.
customer_reviews.author: John Prophet

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: For 931GB, it's fine. Better to get the 7200 RPM version though since it's almost the same price. The drive isn't the best for loading time in certain games or as a boot drive, but the drive works well and is reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good as a storage HDD
customer_reviews.text: Good as a storage HDD. In my mind, if you get a SSD there's no reason for you to have to spend the extra money to get a WD Black HDD. Just take that money and get more TB of space on the blue, or put the money towards the other components you're upgrading. Highly satisfied. I always buy WD, my WD Black that I took out to replace with this and the Samsung 850 EVO is still kicking 4.5 years later, so they make good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: 1st DOA, second one work
customer_reviews.text: Well the first one was DOA so that was disappointing. But I contacted amazon and the rep was super helpful, he had a new one shipped and it arrived the next morning. So literally less than 24 hours later I was all setup. Thankfully the second one worked.
customer_reviews.author: Indie Hydro

customer_reviews.title: Big Blue does it again
customer_reviews.text: This was an easy install, it was shipped fast as always from Amazon. The package was very well padded to prevent damage to the Drive. This drive is 5400 RPM. It isn't lighting fast, but it is excellent value for a storage drive. I have all WD drives with the exception of my SSD for Operating System. It is on Samsung 850 EVO. Until I have a problem with them, WD will be my go to Drives.
customer_reviews.author: ticktoc

customer_reviews.title: Failed,  And Not Eligible For Returns
customer_reviews.text: Ran quietly, and worked great for 1-1/2 weeks, then failed. Non-returnable item with Amazon. Ended up buying a WD Blue 7200 rpm replacement hdd from a local chain store for $10 more.
customer_reviews.author: Dannivou

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. Popped it in and installed windows like a dream! After my SSD crapped out I upgraded to two HDs and haven't looked back. Plus it didnt cost much. Pick one up, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Will update if they fail prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: Shade

customer_reviews.title: Great Value. Great for large file storage with decent read/write.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Good for storage, not made to run gsme@ or any program that needs to load stuff quick. I use it to store movies and audio samples for production.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good hdd. I have never had any issues so far. It works like the first day.
customer_reviews.author: batuhan

customer_reviews.title: That worked fine. The only thing I can say so far ...
customer_reviews.text: only had this a month so not too much to say; used acronis true image from WD to transfer from a really old samsung 500 gig unit. That worked fine. The only thing I can say so far is it was the noisiest hard drive I had ever heard for the first couple of weeks after installing. Now it has quieted down to what i feel is a normal range. It is working fine no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Creel

customer_reviews.title: Great drive. No issues.
customer_reviews.text: Received it in time promised. Good quality, packaged well, and it works. A month after I installed it as my backup drive my computer crashed, and I had to use this drive to retrieve my saved image. Guess it was worth the money too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Scaffidi

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is great hard drive got a really good price on it I was really happy to get it it made my security camera setup easy and less expensive
customer_reviews.author: ronald flart

customer_reviews.title: No SEGA Cable
customer_reviews.text: Great drive installation was quick and easy, the only problem was this didn’t come with a SEGA cable which is one of the cords you need to connect it to your motherboard. be sure to buy a separate SEGA cable when buying this. luckily i had one laying around.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Kring

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a week. So far so good. I wish they still made the Green model, but apparently this is a cross between the old blue and green. It seems to spin down and is quiet when idle, so maybe it's green in effect. I've never had a problem with WD drives. Edit (Sept 12, 2017): Still running like a champ. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: druek

customer_reviews.title: Faster that you think it might be. It is fast
customer_reviews.text: I thought 5400 was just for storage. This thing if properly partitioned will be very speedy indeed due mainly to on board cache but also due to optimal mechanisms (at least so far).
customer_reviews.author: ct

customer_reviews.title: Works as expectred.
customer_reviews.text: No surprises, just reliable service. I did not buy this for gaming. If that's what you want get a SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Allen S.

customer_reviews.title: Installation accessories are NOT included
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive doesn't come with any installation accessories. No SATA data cable, no power connector or screws. If installing as a replacement of existing drive then you are fine, but if installing as a second drive (in my case) then better buy additional accessories in parallel. I haven't installed it yet so can't give you a product review.
customer_reviews.author: sbhama

customer_reviews.title: Basic capacious HDD
customer_reviews.text: Speed is a typical HDD speed. It is not recommended as system HDD, only as additional storage. I Also installed games on it and games work acceptably.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail

customer_reviews.title: Buy these not the seagates!
customer_reviews.text: These are great HDDs. I stay away from the seagates. I’ve never had any problems out of these. Just bought as a secondary storage but worked perfectly with my hot swap bays I have.
customer_reviews.author: Scott121

customer_reviews.title: x
customer_reviews.text: As usual with every WD hard drive I have ever bought, a flawless installation and no issues. And I have probably bought over 10 starting with a 240 MB drive back in the mid 90's. Might still have it somewhere.
